comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: This class shouldn't be placed in common Fineos project for Selenium improvements? As many of the classes under selenium.support package?

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: SAme comment as Daniel, sounds like this should live in claims selenium (or whatever we pull in via Gradle)?

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: There has been communication with Ed Casey over this - there is actually a product defect with the date bean where if you enter values at a particular speed ( I kid you not \! ) the data gets corrupted. That's why the selenium framework for date handling is quite complex because it is always checking that the correct values have been entered. During our Working Days development we added an ajax call to the date processing which resulted in numerous fails. There are some open FDP defects in this area ... long story short, this is code that was written for Admin Suite to process with ajax and dates and it won't be put into the framework.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
I know we spoke about this earlier, but seems I didnt fully follow the intention.
Replacing the JSP with a custom JSP is fine if we are in control of the widget. However, here, we are not in control, so we are basically dependant on its internals.
While we dont have a compile time dependency here, it means that any change in the front office widget will result in this breaking e.g. if they change the name widget.birthDate to widget.dob (or anything basically).
Can we just try rendering the existing widget as it is, since thats what we get for free?
Sorry about the confusion.
